TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit CodeAttributeDeclaration extends System.Object

remarks.format:
## Remarks A CodeAttributeDeclaration can be used to represent an expression that declares an attribute. The attribute name and the arguments for the attribute are stored as properties of the object. A <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeAttributeArgument> can be used to represent each argument for the attribute.
## Examples The following code example creates a CodeAttributeDeclaration that declares a <xref:System.CLSCompliantAttribute> with an argument of `false`:
[!code-cpp[System.CodeDom.CodeAttributeDeclaration#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.codedom.codeatt_0_1.cpp)] [!code-cs[System.CodeDom.CodeAttributeDeclaration#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.codedom.codeatt_0_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.CodeDom.CodeAttributeDeclaration#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.codedom.codeatt_0_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified code type reference.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `attributeType` parameter is used to set the <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeAttributeDeclaration.AttributeType%2A> and <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeAttributeDeclaration.Name%2A> properties.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string name) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified name.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.CodeDom.CodeTypeReference attributeType, class System.CodeDom.CodeAttributeArgument[] arguments) cil managed

Docs.param: An array of type that contains the arguments for the attribute.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified code type reference and arguments.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `attributeType` parameter is used to set the <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeAttributeDeclaration.AttributeType%2A> and <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeAttributeDeclaration.Name%2A> properties, and the `arguments` parameter is used to set the <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeAttributeDeclaration.Arguments%2A> property for the <xref:System.CodeDom.CodeAttributeDeclaration>.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified name and arguments.
Gets the arguments for the attribute.
Docs.value: A that contains the arguments for the attribute.

Docs.summary: Gets the code type reference for the code attribute declaration.
Gets or sets the name of the attribute being declared.
